__e: Jim, but look, you didn't trust my father to begin with, and he turned out an awful lot different than you thought.
The person I trusted most in the world - the person that I thought told me everything -
Because the man I trusted most in the world had killed the son of our best friend.
She just trusted me enough to leave me alone and let me figure stuff out for myself.
It wasn't you didn't trust me... you just wanted to make sure...
I didn't know if I could trust you, and I knew you didn't trust me.
I couldn't imagine why she would let anyone like you go, because you were practically my best friend, because I trusted you.
You're so goddamn strong, Alice. And when it was just you and me, And we didn't have a fucking soul on our side,
He knew you were brilliant, and this is proof of it.
Mom said in a letter that we got the day after she died that she thought it was time for her to go because she didn't trust herself not to do something stupid.
I had a chance to go with people that I didn't trust and an alliance of six versus four, or I had a chance to go with four people they could trust.
It wasn't you didn't trust me... you just wanted to make sure...
He was someone who trusted her, who worked for her, and, ultimately, was murdered by her.
Uh, wait, an hour ago you didn't trust her, because she had some sort of strange hold over George, and now suddenly she's great?
Well, you did it 'cause you trusted her... and you needed somebody to talk to.
Maybe he's thinking about a man who moved in on a friend that trusted him. Sneaked in behind his back like a weasel in a hen coop and stole the one thing his friend valued most.
Partly because I didn't trust him, and partly because he was born rich and handsome and I was born poor and not handsome.
When he stayed with us, two years ago... I trusted him to baby-sit my kids... and then one day he was gone.
